conclusion: Determine the refractive index using Snell's law and the geometry of the problem.
Outer diameter is twice the inner diameter, so radius of outer sphere is 2R and radius of inner sphere is R.
Light grazes the inner surface of the sphere, so angle of refraction at the inner surface is 90 degrees.
Apply Snell's law: n1 sin i = n2 sin r, where n1 is refractive index of vacuum (1), i = 45 degrees, r = 90 degrees.
Calculate n2: 1 * sin 45 degrees = n2 * sin 90 degrees, n2 = 1/sqrt(2).
Refractive index n is the ratio of speed of light in vacuum to speed of light in the material.
Determine path length in material using geometry of sphere.
Path length in material is distance from A to B along surface of sphere.
Use law of sines in triangle AOB: AB/sin theta = OA/sin (180 degrees - theta) = 2R/sin theta.
Calculate AB: AB = 2R * sin theta/sin theta = 2R.
Refractive index is distance in vacuum/distance in material = path length in vacuum/path length in material = sqrt(2).
The refractive index of the transparent material is sqrt(2).
